content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is a possible implementation of the `extract_julia_code` function in Julia:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)
    doc = MD.parse(IOBuffer(md))
    
    # Find all code blocks with language set to "julia"
    julia_blocks = filter(b -> b isa Block && b.lang == "julia", doc.blocks)
    
    # Remove code fences and join the code blocks together
    extracted_code = join([block.content for block in julia_blocks], "\n")
    
    return extracted_code
end
```

This function first parses the input markdown string into a document object using the `Markdown` package. It then filters out all code blocks with the language set to "julia", removes any code fences (triple backticks), and joins the remaining content together with newlines. The resulting string is returned as the output of the function.
